thread.title: Swimming with pigs in the Bahamas could soon be a thing of the past as only seven of them are still alive
thread.title_full: Swimming with pigs in the Bahamas could soon be a thing of the past as only seven of them are still alive

title: Swimming with pigs in the Bahamas could soon be a thing of the past as only seven of them are still alive
text:
Mrs Crunch EAU NO! Swimming with pigs in the Bahamas could soon be a thing of the past as only seven of them are still alive 
Several of the pig colony at Big Major Cay have suddenly dropped dead By Caroline McGuire, Digital Travel Editor 22nd February 2017, 6:26 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments The swimming pigs of the Bahamas are pretty big stars – tourists come from far and wide to paddle in the ocean with them. 
But the famous animals, who live in a colony at Big Major Cay, could soon be a thing of the past as several have suddenly dropped dead, thought to be from food poisoning. Alamy The swimming pigs of the Bahamas are a big tourist attraction 
According to reports, there are now just seven or eight pigs left. 
The Bahamas Humane Society has now launched an official investigation into why the deaths have occurred. RELATED STORIES HOT MAMMA Tamara Ecclestone shows off her amazing post-baby bikini body with daughter Sophia on holiday in the Bahamas BEACH BUM Emily Ratajkowski gives fans a very merry Christmas by posting a belfie from her Bahamas getaway with Bella Hadid OPEN WIDE Dentist describes being attacked by deadly bull shark as he fished on paradise holiday to the Bahamas kylie's birthday (swim)suit Kardashians star Kylie Jenner and her pals strip to their bikinis to celebrate her 19th birthday in the Bahamas 
They have taken a series of water samples to try to determine the cause of death and work out they were accidental or intentional. 
BHS President Kim Aranha told the local paper The Tribune : “It could just be a horrible accident where they ate something poisonous.” Alamy According to reports, there are now just seven or eight pigs left after several dropped dead suddenly Alamy 4 The famous animals live in a colony at Big Major Cay 
Kim continued: “It could be malicious but I don’t really see why someone would go out of their way to hurt those lovely animals. 
“I know there are a lot of silly sailors that go and feed them alcohol to try and get them drunk but that’s not to mistake them with the tour operators based out of Nassau who have treated them with excellent care.”
